    • Method Detail

      • randInt

        public static int randInt​(int min,
                          int max)
        Generate a random integer between two values, inclusive.
        Parameters:
        min - Minimum in the range of possible integers generated.
        max - Maximum in the range of possible integers generated.
        Returns:
        A randomly generated integer in the specified range.
        See Also:
        Random.nextInt()

      • tic

        public static void tic()
        Start timing. tic and toc are basically equivalent to the MATLAB versions. Because this is static, any piece of code which calls these will be messing with the same timer. This can be useful, but means that if we want to time many processes at once, we should use a different timing approach.

      • toc

        public static long toc()
        Return the elapsed time in nanoseconds since the last time tic() was called. Also prints a human-readable seconds or milliseconds count.
        Returns:
        Nanoseconds since last tic call.

      • stringToLogFile

        public static void stringToLogFile​(java.lang.String contents,
                                   java.lang.String outPath)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Write a string to file.
        Parameters:
        contents - String to be written in the file.
        outPath - Full path and filename of the log file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - File cannot be opened or written to.

      • sectionToLogFile

        public static void sectionToLogFile​(java.lang.String inPath,
                                    java.lang.String outPath)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Write some part of a file to a log. Begin logging with !LOG_START and end with !LOG_END. This can be done multiple times in the same file. This is useful when we want to record the settings specified in a configuration file to a log file.
        Parameters:
        inPath - Full path and filename of the file to selectively send to log.
        outPath - Full path and filename of the log file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - File cannot be opened or written to.

      • clearExistingFile

        public static boolean clearExistingFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Delete a specified file, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        fileName - File we wish to delete.
        Returns:
        True if the file was deleted by this method; false if the file could not be deleted or did not exist.

      • generateFileName

        public static java.lang.String generateFileName​(java.lang.String prefix,
                                                java.lang.String fileExtension)
        Generate a timestamped filename. Format is: [prefix]_YYYY-MM-DD_HH-mm-ss.[fileExtension].
        Parameters:
        prefix - String to place at the beginning of the filename.
        fileExtension - String to place at the end of the file name as a file extension.
        Returns:
        String for a timestamped file name.
        See Also:
        getTimestamp()

      • getTimestamp

        public static java.lang.String getTimestamp()
        Get a timestamp in string form.

      • loadConfigFile

        public static java.util.Properties loadConfigFile​(java.io.File file)
        Load a configuration file.
        Parameters:
        file - File (not filename) of the config file we wish to load.
        Returns:
        Properties object which is a Hashtable containing property names and property settings as key/value pairs.

      • getExecutionPath

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String getExecutionPath()
        Deprecated.
        Returns the path that the code is being executed from. Can be useful since relative paths can get screwy depending on whether the code is running in the IDE, command line, .jar, etc.
        Returns:
        String name of the path the the code is executing from.

      • showOnScreen

        public static void showOnScreen​(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                int screen,
                                boolean fullScreen)
        Make a JFrame go to the specified monitor (by index) and match its size. Choose whether to make it full screen or not.
        Parameters:
        frame - Frame to move and resize.
        screen - Index of the monitor to use.
        fullScreen - Maximize to completely full screen? This will not have an upper toolbar.
        See Also:
        StackOverflow thread

      • shuffleArray

        public static void shuffleArray​(java.lang.Object[] ar)
